Wisdom: حَرَامٌ عَلَى كُلِّ عَقْلٍ مَغْلُولٍ بِالشَّهْوَةِ أَنْ يَنْتَفِعَ بِالْحِكْمَةِ
enWisdom: It is forbidden upon every intellect that is shacked by (or sick with) lust to benefit from wisdom
The departure [and loss] of intellect is between vain desire and lust

Wisdom: غَيْرُ مُنْتَفِعٍ بِالْعِظَاتِ قَلْبٌ مُتَعَلِّقٌ [تَعَلَّقَ‏] بِالشَّهَوَاتِ
enWisdom: The heart that is attached to lustful desires is unable to benefit from sincere exhortations
Whoever overcomes his lust, his intellect becomes manifested
There is no reason with lust
Lustful desire and wisdom do not go together

Wisdom: لَا يَنْبَغِي أَنْ يَعُدَّ عَاقِلًا مَنْ يَغْلِبُهُ الْغَضَبُ وَالشَّهْوَةُ
enWisdom: He who is overcome by anger and lust should not be counted as an intelligent person
Self-admiration is contrary to reason and the bane of the intellects
The bane of intellect is self-conceit
The worst of all woes of the intellect is arrogance
One who is haughty does not learn
